title: Brooklyn Tequila Fest
description: Discover, sip, and savor at the Brooklyn Tequila Fest with more than 100 styles of tequila, mezcal, spirits, cocktails, and more. Enjoy unlimited samples, live entertainment, and food available for purchase.
address: Brooklyn Navy Yard Building 77 Waterfront Promenade, 141 Flushing Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205

title: University Open Air: Fall Edition
description: Immigrant teachers, professors, and academics share their knowledge with the public at a series of free classes around Prospect Park Boathouse.

title: Illumination NYC Light Art Festival
description: The annual light festival features 15+ light installations, performances, and food trucks.

title: Bryant Park Square Dance
description: Bryant Park’s annual midtown hoedown featuring live music, mechanical bull rides, and lawn games.

title: Winging It: An Open Mic Night at Lofty Pigeon Books
description: An open mic night for sharing scripts, poems, music, and jokes at Kensington’s Lofty Pigeon Books.

title: Limousine Reading Series
description: Hear new works from various writers at the 'dark academia' themed edition of the Limousine Reading Series.

title: Risk! Live Show and Story Slam
description: Hear guests tell true stories they never thought they’d share in public at Kevin Allison’s Risk! show.

title: NYC Magic Ensemble
description: A night of magicians and mentalists at Young Ethel’s featuring various performers.

title: Scream Scene Presents: Poltergeist Screening and Horror Hangout
description: A screening of the supernatural horror classic Poltergeist at Cassette, followed by a hangout with other horror fans.

title: Seventh Annual Mobile Dance Film Festival
description: The first film festival to screen dance films shot solely on mobile devices returns with 10 new shorts.
address: 280 Broadway Gibney: Agnes Varis Performing Arts Center, Civic Center/Tribeca

title: Opera Italiana in Central Park: Opera Unbound: A Sunset Serenade
description: An outdoor performance featuring selections by Verdi, Leoncavallo, Mascagni, Puccini, and Rossini at Central Park’s Naumburg Bandshell.

title: Letters + Sodas: LIC Reading Series
description: A night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings featuring various writers and comedians.

title: Not in My Backyard! A Political Comedy Roundtable
description: A panel of opinionated NYC comedians, journalists, and politicians debate local issues causing drama in neighborhood Facebook groups.

title: Fightin’ Words! A Language Game Show
description: Contestants compete in word-based games to win a new word added to the people’s lexicon.

title: Target Margin Theater's The Degenerate Lab
description: For the first time since the pandemic, the Target Margin Theater lab returns with The Degenerate Lab, a series of productions answering the question, ‘what is degenerate art now?’ Featuring various performances and events.

title: Myrtle Avenue Negroni Week
description: Raise a glass at this week-long celebration of the iconic Italian cocktail! 10 local bars and restaurants will showcase exclusive menus.

title: We Love a Theme: A Storytelling Show
description: A lineup of performers tell funny, heartwarming, and cringe-inducing tales at Bailey Swilley’s monthly storytelling show. Tonight’s ‘bad apples’ theme features various performers.

title: Sixties Surreal at the Whitney
description: A new exhibition at the Whitney Museum explores how artists in 1960s America used surrealism to respond to the era's social and political changes.
cost: $30 general, $24 seniors/students, free for 25 and under
